description_preview: We are the official juggling and object manipulation club of the University of Chicago!
full_description: Official juggling and object manipulation club at the University of Chicago. Join us for endless fun and skill-building!

name: Kababayan
description_preview: We are a cultural and social RSO of the University of Chicago. Our mission is to provide an inclusive community for Filipinos, Filipino-Americans, and Southeast Asians at the University of Chicago.
full_description: Kababayan (KBB@UofC), which means "fellow countrymen" in Tagalog, the national dialect of the Philippines, is the Filipino and Filipino-American interest organization at the University of Chicago. We aim to create a fun, tight-knit, and socially conscientious community for Filipino, Filipino-American, and other interested students on campus, as well as spread Filipino culture through study breaks, cultural activities, service events, outreach endeavors, and collaborative community efforts, and research. We encourage collaboration with other organizations and celebrate campus diversity. We welcome students of all backgrounds and anyone who is interested in learning more about the Philippines and its culture.

name: Kappa Theta Pi
description_preview: Kappa Theta Pi is UChicago's first professional technology fraternity focused on five pillars: professional development, alumni connections, social growth, technological advancement, and academic support.

additional_info.Parent Organization Name and Website::
Kappa Theta Pi Professional Technology Fraternity
http://kappathetapi.com/

name: Kendo Club
description_preview: Kendo is a Japanese form of fencing with two-handed bamboo swords, originally developed as a safe form of sword training for samurai. The Kendo club exists to promote and instruct on the practice of Kendo among UChicago students.
full_description: In our schedule, we have:Advanced PracticesonMonday evenings,Beginner PracticesonWednesday evenings, andHybridPracticesonSunday mornings. Follow our mailing list (bottom of this page) to receive updates.Ouronline schedulewill give you exact information. NOTE: Masks are optional in our practices. E-mail us with questions/suggestions/concerns regarding this. Come to a practice, and we will get you started! No previous experience in kendo or other martial arts is required, just an eagerness to participate. Training for kendo involves quite a bit of high-intensity exercise, so whether you're looking to compete or to get a substantial workout, we highly suggest that you give it a shot! For more information, email Saul at smeyerf@uchicago.edu or Fabricio at fabriciohswei@uchicago.edu, or visitkendo.uchicago.edu.

additional_info.Regular Meetings (Day/Time/Location):: Advanced Practices Tuesdays 6:00pm-8:00pm (Ida Noyes) or  7:00pm-9:00pm (Ratner) - check calendar. Beginner Practices are Thursdays 8:30pm-10:30pm and Fridays 7:00pm-8:45pm (Ratner) and Some Sundays (Ida Noyes, see calendar)

description_preview: Spring 2024 New RSO
full_description: We are the only Bengali students' association at the University of Chicago.

name: Kitchen Sink
description_preview: Kitchen Sink is a student organization that seeks to foster a stronger visual arts community at UChicago by providing materials, a location, and a community for drawing and painting through weekly painting sessions, group critiques, and other art events.
full_description: Kitchen Sink holds weekly painting sessions at the Great Hall in Logan Art Center, in which we provide all sorts of paint media, supports, etc. to any student who comes. Other than the painting sessions, we hold quarterly events and workshops that focus on collaboration between art and other disciplines. Past events have included Fab Lab workshops at the CIE, a mental health pop up museum in collaboration with Active Minds, and others. We have also had pop-up museums exhibiting student artwork on- and off-campus. A note about Blueprint membership: Kitchen Sink does not have a membership system. We have a small board and open sessions that do not require affiliation. We do have a Facebook page you can like/follow to stay updated on our projects: https://www.facebook.com/uckitchensink. You can also follow us at @uckitchensink on Instagram.

name: Kojo Daiko
description_preview:
Kojo Daiko is UChicago's one and only Japanese drumming group! Join us for weekly practices and keep an eye out for our performances. Absolutely no experience required! 

Spring 2024 New RSO
full_description: We are UChicago's one and only Japanese drumming group! Join us for weekly practices and keep an eye out for our performances. Absolutely no experience required!

name: Koong
description_preview: Koong is a traditional Korean drumming RSO specializing in Samul-Nori. We seek to learn and perform the art, as well as share it with the University and greater Chicago community.
full_description: Koongis a traditional Korean drumming RSO specializing in Samul-Nori. We seek to learn and perform the art, as well as share it with the University and greater Chicago community. We welcome all new members and encourage them to join!

name: Korean Students Organization
description_preview: KSO provides a community for Koreans, Korean-Americans and non-Koreans interested in Korean culture through activities that promote a positive Korean cultural presence on campus.
full_description: Founded in 1976, the Korean Students Organization (KSO) is a registered student organization at the University of Chicago. Since then, we have grown tremendously and boast having more than 100 active undergraduate and graduate members each year. Setting a precedent in 1980, we hosted the first culture show on campus and have since established an annual KSO tradition for the past 33 years. Our mission is to represent the Korean community and strengthen its voice on (and beyond) campus and to bring together those who have a common interest in Korean culture through social activities and events. Additionally, we seek to extend an open dialogue between a diverse range of ethnic groups in order to establish a positive relationship for the whole of the University community. Finally, we hope to spread awareness of the Korean culture to the entire student body by sponsoring various University-wide events. Our constitution may be found here. We also seek to give to the community by raising funds for various charitable organizations like Korean American Women In Need (KANWIN) and Agglobe Services (North Korean food aid). For more information about KSO, please join the KSO listhost. If you have further questions, feel free to contact any of the board members. Also feel free to come out to an event even if you have not attended any of the previous events or joined the listhost.

name: Kreyòl Club
description_preview: A language club that focuses on Haitian Creole. We hold language tables, as well as other events pertaining to language learning but also Haiti in general.

name: Lacrosse (Men's)
description_preview: To play and teach the game of lacrosse at a collegiate level. Playing in the Division 1 Great Lakes Lacrosse League (GLLL). Won D2 GLLL Championship with 11-0 record in 2024 Season.

name: Latin American Matters
description_preview: Organization of Latin America and the Caribbean Students at the University of Chicago
full_description: Through a public policy approach, Latin American Matters promotes the discussion and better understanding of economic, social, cultural, and political contexts in Latin American countries. In that character, LAM will:1. Promote activities to increase awareness of Latin America’s economic, social, and political situation from a public policy perspective.2. Promote a better understanding of the culture and idiosyncrasy of Latin American countries within the University of Chicago community.3. Promote the professional development of LAM members by disseminating information about organizations in the US and abroad that address pressing issues in Latin America or collaborate with LATAM organizations.

additional_info.Regular Meetings (Day/Time/Location):: Tuesdays/17:00 pm/ The Keller Center (biweekly meeting)

name: Latino Medical Student Association
description_preview: LMSA represents, supports, and unifies Latino/a medical students and underrepresented pre-medical undergraduates, and collaborates with all who are committed to increasing the proportion of underrepresented minority medical students and faculty.
full_description: The purpose of this organization shall be to represent, support, and unify Latino/a medical students and underrepresented pre-medical undergraduates. The group is dedicated to increasing the proportion of underrepresented minority medical students and faculty, educating on issues affecting the Latino community, serving underserved communities through volunteerism and advocacy, and creating an environment conducive to the extraordinary success of Latinos at the University of Chicago.

additional_info.Parent Organization Name and Website::
National Latino Medical Student Association
(www.lmsa.net)

Latino Medical Student Association Midwest Region
(www.lmsa.net/midwest)

name: Latinx Law Students Association
description_preview: Our organization exists to create an academic and social support network to help students adjust to the rigors of law school. Our diverse membership includes Latinx students from all parts of Latin America, the Iberian Peninsula, and the U.S.
full_description: The Latinx Law Student Association (LLSA) fosters an academic, professional, and social support network to help students adjust to the rigors of law school. Our diverse membership includes people from all parts of Latin America, the Iberian Peninsula, and the United States. LLSA offers programs that focus on professional and academic development, such as mock interviews and mentoring. We also bring in speakers to discuss legal issues affecting Latin(x) communities in the U.S. and abroad. LLSA keeps our members abreast of diversity scholarships, Latin(x)-centered events around campus, and potential employment opportunities. We endeavor to share the incredible diversity of Latin(x) cultures with The University of Chicago Law School at large. LLSA social events are an important part of how we create our community. We host alumni mixers, potluck dinners, salsa dancing outings, museum visits, and much more. These events aim to help build community and familiarity amongst Latin(x) and non-Latin(x) friends and classmates. We are proud to say that LLSA is one of the most active and inclusive minority organizations at the Law School.

name: Law and Economics Society
description_preview: The Law and Economics Society aims to improve the student body understanding of the application of economic methodologies to the law, as well as raise awareness of opportunities in the field for undergraduate and graduate students.
full_description: The Law and Economics Society hosts guest lecturers and faculty experts in public fora across the host of topics implicated by the application of economic methodologies to the study of the law. Furthermore, the LES provides resources to students interested in current and future opportunities in the field. Lecture topics have ranged from environmental policy, to new institutional economics, to careers in Law and Economics.  Please contact us for information in how to get more involved in our initiatives.

additional_info.Regular Meetings (Day/Time/Location):: Lunch talks and various other events

name: Law of the Land
description_preview: Law of the Land seeks to expose University of Chicago students to the many legal issues surrounding land use policy, environmental law, and development in Chicago and around the United States.
full_description: The mission of Law of the Land is to expose University of Chicago students to legal issues physically grounded in Chicago and elsewhere.  The organization organizes a series of site visits and lunch talks focused on three types of land- and water-related legal issues: (1) environmental, (2) housing, and (3) land use/urban redevelopment.

name: Law Women's Caucus
description_preview: The mission of Women's Law Caucus (LWC) is to promote the interests of women within the law school and beyond.
full_description: The Law Women’s Caucus (LWC) promotes the interests of women at the law school and beyond. Our mission is to create a space in which women in the University of Chicago Law community can find comfort and mentorship, cultivate new skills and passions, and grow as lawyers and as people. Independently, and in collaboration with other student organizations, we provide student support and professional development coaching, cultivate relationships among students and alumni of the Law School, and amplify the richly diverse voices of women and underrepresented genders in the legal profession. With your support, we will host informative guest speakers, hold social and wellness events to forge friendships, and invest in the Chicago community through volunteer work.

name: Le Vorris & Vox Circus
description_preview: An amateur circus troupe interested in exploring and pushing physical and artistic boundaries.  Common skills include juggling, poi, other manipulation, partner acrobatics, and aerials such as silks, trapeze, and lyra.
full_description: Le Vorris & Vox is the University of Chicago’s very own circus network and troupe! Le Vorris & Vox strives to bring the incredible joys of the circus arts to anyone and everyone on campus. The members of Le Vorris & Vox work together to learn and train inaerial silks, partner acrobatics and tumbling, cyr wheel, burlesque, fire manipulation, unicycling, trapeze, lyra, and more!We also welcome those who are more interested in the technical aspects of circus: mask and puppet makers, stage designers, writers, actors, dancers, musicians, improvers, jesters, etc. Le Vorris & Vox brings people together by harnessing the power of peer-teaching and skill-sharing, as well the exciting wonders of show-development and performance, in an environment that is both physically and mentally fulfilling! All levels of interest and skill are welcome! Join our Facebook groupfor information about practices, tips for tricks, and cool events around Chicago, orlike our Facebook pagefor updates about upcoming shows!

additional_info.Regular Meetings (Day/Time/Location):: Sunday, Logan 701, 10am-4pm; Monday, Logan 701 6:30-10pm; Friday, Logan 701 6:30-10pm

name: Lean on Me
description_preview: Lean On Me UChicago operates a text-based emotional support line, run by and for our peers. We strive to provide easy access to confidential, non-crisis support. Each quarter, we train new student supporters in empathetic listening skills.
full_description: We envision a world where everyone can seek and receive emotional support. Lean On Me's peer-to-peer text line strives to provide easy access to confidential, non-crisis support ❤️ / Each quarter, we train new student supporters in how to offer empathetic listening through SMS text conversations. We also host refresher trainings and community events for current LOM members. / Our line number is 773-295-2306 and is open to all students seeking support ☎️ / If you're interested in becoming a student supporter or just curious to learn more about our work, please visit our website at https://lean0n.me/uchicago/

additional_info.Regular Meetings (Day/Time/Location):: Bi-weekly starting 3rd week of every quarter

name: Life of the Mic
description_preview: Life of the Mic is UChicago's stand up comedy club. Our goal is to provide the UChicago community with opportunities to collaborate with other students during writers' workshops, test material at supportive open mics, and perform in quarterly showcases!

name: Lutheran Campus Ministry
description_preview: We are an open and affirming campus ministry that serves the undergraduate and graduate students of the University of Chicago. All are welcome to gather with us for fellowship, worship, study, and service!
full_description: Life is richer, truer, and freer when we follow Jesus together. Whoever you are and wherever you are on your spiritual journey, Lutheran Campus Ministry is a place to experience the good news that you are loved. Join us weekly as we explore faith and life, share a meal, and do justice together in the name of Jesus. All are welcome.Really.

additional_info.Regular Meetings (Day/Time/Location):: Thursdays, 6:30 pm – 8:00 pm, at Augustana Lutheran Church of Hyde Park (5500 S. Woodlawn Ave.)

name: Major Activities Board
description_preview: The Major Activities Board (MAB) has been bringing concerts and other high-quality entertainment events to the University of Chicago campus for over 25 years. MAB's aim is to book a variety of diverse, innovative, and exciting entertainment acts.
full_description: The Major Activities Board (MAB) is a recognized student organization (RSO) that brings concerts and other entertainment events to the University of Chicago campus. Members of the organization choose and book the acts, produce the events, create publicity materials, and manage all other aspects of the show. MAB typically holds three events per year including a concert in the fall, an electronic music event in the winter, and a music festival in the spring known as "Summer Breeze."

name: Make Chicago Smile
description_preview: Make Chicago Smile organises and supports projects that spread positivity across campus

name: Malaysian Students Association
description_preview: The purpose of this organization is to provide a welcoming space for incoming Malaysian students as well as promoting the culture and identity of Malaysia within the university community.
full_description: Selamat datang (Malay for Welcome)! MaSA, an acronym for the Malaysian Students Association, is one of the many cultural-based Registered Student Organizations (RSOs) in the University of Chicago. As its name implies, MaSA provides a welcoming space and social networking platform for the (although certainly not limited to) Malaysian community of the University of Chicago.Our larger goal is to promote Malaysian culture in contributing to the diversity and richness of the student life at UChicago.

name: Maria Shelters Resource Connection Program
description_preview: The Maria Shelter RSO offers weekly, evening-time tutoring and childcare at a women's and children's shelter in Englewood, Chicago. Our facilitators serve children of all ages while their mothers attend medical and social work clinics.
full_description: The Maria Shelter RSO offers weekly, evening-time tutoring and childcare at a women and children's shelter in Englewood, Chicago. Our group is dedicated to providing tutoring and childcare of the highest quality. We also strive to promote equity in housing and education and to uplift children experiencing housing insecurity. Our shelter visits take place on Wednesdays from 6 pm - 8:30 pm. Please reach out to any of the co-presidents for information on how to get involved.

name: Maroon Capital
description_preview: Maroon Capital is UChicago’s oldest and largest quantitative finance RSO with an aim to provide education, career and networking resources, and talent development for our members.
full_description: Maroon Capital is UChicago’s oldest and largest quantitative finance RSO with an aim to provide education, career and networking resources, and talent development for our members. Since 2010, we've established and expanded our own industry-relevant curriculum covering topics in quantitative and fundamental finance, statistics, market making, and coding. If you're a prospective member, please visit our website (mc.uchicago.edu) for more information / questions.

name: Maroon TV
description_preview: Series and films created by UChicago students, for UChicago students.

name: Maroons for Israel
description_preview: Maroons for Israel
full_description: For over 40 years, Maroons for Israel (formerly, UChicago Friends of Israel) has been the pro-Israel voice on the UChicago campus.We aim to be an inclusive, pro-active, and pro-Israel voice that promotes open dialogue about Israeli history, culture, and politics at the UChicago campus. Maroons for Israel advocates for the existence of the Jewish and democratic state. We work to build relationships with various on and off campus partners in order to form a more educated and informed pro-Israel community.  We attempt to represent all of the many opinions and perspectives held by supporters of Israel. Our events, from free food on the quads to movie screenings to speeches by journalists and historians, are meant for everyone -- people with a long-standing love of Israel and people who are curious about the country.

name: Math Club
description_preview: Undergraduate math club, all are welcome! We schedule math-related activities and lectures for those enthusiastic about mathematics.
full_description: The math club is an informal group of students. We meet weekly to enjoy lectures from all interested participants, professors, or grad students, discuss mathematics, hunt for even primes, and have fun. We are not the correct people to contact for job listings or campus recruiting events.  Please use official university channels for these purposes. We are the correct people to contact if you have found any new even primes. If you are interested in joining, please join our mailing list at https://lists.uchicago.edu/web/info/mathclub

name: MECHA
description_preview:
MECHA is a student organization that promotes social justice, higher education, culture, and history by hosting various events and campaigns.

Previously known as M.E.Ch.A.
full_description: To commit ourselves to education and awareness of issues concerning the Latino/a/e/x community through community service, social activism, campus awareness, and education as a means of change. To participate as a chapter of MECHA, a nationwide, historical Latino/a/e/x student movement.

additional_info.Regular Meetings (Day/Time/Location):: Wednesday, 7:30 pm, Center for Identity and Inclusion

name: Med-ucate
description_preview: Med-ucate promotes awareness about the importance of health and self-care among underserved communities, connecting University students to education opportunities through free student-led interactive workshops with local organizations.
full_description: Med-ucate’s mission is to promote awareness about the importance of health and self-care among underserved communities. We partner with local organizations that cater to children to hold free classes centered around understanding human anatomy and physiology to make health-conscious decisions. Some organizations we work with include local libraries, organizations for students with diverse learning needs, and after-school programs. Med-ucate emphasizes a hands-on and interactive style of learning, and our classes are heavily activity- and discussion-based. Our members are passionate about education and health and can contribute to our mission regardless of background, area of study, or prior experience teaching. INTEREST FORM: www.tinyurl.com/uchimeducate

additional_info.Parent Organization Name and Website::
Students Promoting Action, Responsibility, and Knowledge (SPARK)
https://www.sparkchanges.org/,
https://www.med-ucate.org/

name: Meditation and Buddhist Groups of UChicago
description_preview: The Meditation and Buddhist Groups of UChicago is an umbrella organization for all Buddhist and meditation groups on campus. We organize speakers, events, and weekend meditation retreats.
full_description: The Meditation and Buddhist Groups of UChicago is an umbrella organization for all Buddhist and meditation groups on campus. We organize speakers, events, and weekend meditation retreats. Sign up for our mailing list: https://lists.uchicago.edu/web/info/buddhistFollow us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ucbuddhist

additional_info.Regular Meetings (Day/Time/Location):: Every month while the quarter is in session

name: MEDLIFE
description_preview: MEDLIFE is a community service organization focused on raising local and global health awareness in the University of Chicago community through fundraising and organization of mobile clinics & development projects in Ecuador, Peru, and Tanzania.
full_description: MEDLIFE stands for "Medicine, Education, and Development to Low Income Families Everywhere." Our RSO focuses on the intersection of these components in developing health and well-being on the South Side of Chicago and in our international chapter settings. Equity and sustainability are the driving values in the work we do both on campus and in communities abroad. The cornerstone of MEDLIFE is week-long mobile clinic trips to improve access to basic healthcare in low-resource communities in Latin America. These trips are open to the general campus community, and provide an opportunity for students to engage in sustainable, locally-driven health clinics and development projects in rural communities. We also raise funds for development projects in Ecuador, Peru, and Tanzania that provide sustainable change in a culturally sensitive manner by funding clinics, schools, and safe living environments.Additionally, our chapter prioritizes local community engagement to improve health and well-being. The Community Service Committee organizes service trips to community-based organizations like Heartland Alliance Vital Bridges Food Pantry, Hyde Park Neighborhood Club, or Ronald McDonald House Charities.Our last goal as an organization is to increase awareness among the University community about global health and issues such as health equity. We strive to give students at the University a chance to discuss and research pertinent health problems, while also inviting multidisciplinary guest speakers to lead discussions or participate in panel presentations. For more information about MEDLIFE as an international organization, please visithttps://www.medlifemovement.org/.

name: Medusa
description_preview: Medusa (formerly Men in Drag) is a high-voices, student a cappella group. We accept female and gender-neutral identities to bring spunk, grit, and heart to the genre. Medusa holds itself to a high standard of modern musical entertainment.
full_description: Medusa is an award-winning, historically all female group with an extensive rep of bold and empowering music from all genres, covering everyone from Lady Gaga, Panic! At the Disco, and Hozier to Janelle Monáe, Lorde, and Lana del Rey. Medusa’s covers have been featured on various national compilation albums, and their recent solo album, Medusa Complex, was met with critical acclaim. The group changed their name, so if you are looking for the group formerly known as Men in Drag, this is it! They are still performing and recording music that uplifts, empowers, and reflectsboth the inclusivity and the complexities of their identity as a group.

name: Memoryhouse
description_preview: Memoryhouse Magazine is a quarterly arts and lit publication that encourages undergraduates, graduates, faculty, and staff to share their first-person narratives with one another through writing, visual art and live performance.
full_description: CHICAGOMEMORYHOUSE.WORDPRESS.COM Memoryhouse is a student-run literary magazine that encourages undergraduates, graduates, faculty, and staff to share their first-person narratives with one another through writing. While the magazine requires all submissions to feature a first-person voice and present a concrete narrative, it accepts all literary genres, as well as original art and photography. Memoryhouse releases one to three issues per academic year and hosts a fully functional website.

name: Men's Rugby
description_preview: We are UChicago Men's Rugby. We play a competitive fall season and a social spring season. All skill levels are welcome, including those who have never played before.
full_description: Established in 1933. We play the game of rugby at the competitive DII level. All skill levels welcome, new comers encouraged who will be taught this exceptional sport.

name: Men’s/Coed Squash Club
description_preview: The UChicago Squash Club is the University’s organization dedicated to the sport of Squash.  Founded in 2013, the club is now one of the premier club squash teams in the country, offering programming for both competitive and recreational players.
full_description: The University of Chicago Squash Club is the University’s organization dedicated to the sport of Squash.  Founded in 2013, the club has grown to be one of the premier club squash teams in the country, offering programming for both competitive players hoping to play against other college squash programs and to recreational players learning how to play the game.

additional_info.Regular Meetings (Day/Time/Location):: Monday, Tuesday, Thursday 7:30 PM and Saturdays at 1:30 PM

name: Middle Eastern Studies Student Association
description_preview: An organization for students with an academic interest in the modern or ancient Middle East.
full_description: MESSA is a student organization that promotes and sponsors academic, social and cultural activities designed to bring together students from a broad spectrum of disciplines to celebrate and understand Middle Eastern cultural diversity. MESSA events are dedicated to fostering scholastic and personal cooperation among students intellectually involved with the study of the Middle East.

name: Midwave Radio
description_preview: Midwave Radio is an online student radio station born at UChicago, created in 2020 and launched in January 2021. Made by and for students everywhere with love. Rolling applications for time slots are always open.
full_description: Midwave Radio offers an online platform for UChicago students to broadcast their affection for music, conversation, or some perfect combination of both. Midwave also puts on concerts and events that feature UChicago’s finest student artists and artists in the surrounding Chicago community. Apply for a show today!

additional_info.Regular Meetings (Day/Time/Location):: Board meetings bi-weekly on Sundays at noon in Stuart Cubicles; club meetings on Tuesdays, location and time varies

name: Midway Ventures
description_preview: Midway offers pro-bono advisory services for Chicago-based startups and venture capital firms, with the goal of supporting the rapid growth of Chicago's startup ecosystem and democratizing venture capital for UChicago students.
full_description: Midway Ventures is a student-run venture capital and pro-bono consulting group based at the University of Chicago, with the goal of supporting the rapid growth of Chicago’s startup ecosystem. Our associates work hands-on to develop relationships with VC firms, entrepreneurs, and the UChicago community and organize events to democratize venture capital and entrepreneurship. More information is available atwww.midwayvc.com

name: Minorities in Public Policy Studies
description_preview: MiPPS serves as an academic, social and cultural resource for policy students at Chicago Harris.
full_description: MiPPS serves as an academic, social and cultural resource for policy students at Harris Public Policy. Our goals are to raise awareness concerning issues pertaining to Harris' underrepresented minority students and the greater community; increase the number of underrepresented minorities at the Harris School and promote civic participation within Chicago Harris, the University of Chicago, and the greater community.

name: Mock Trial Team
description_preview: Mock Trial at UChicago is an award-winning program that trains its members in the arts of rhetoric, argument, and even acting. Team members build a case as both attorneys and witnesses, and travel to tournaments across the country.
full_description: Mock Trial is an RSO in which students compete against other universities, arguing legal cases before a jury in the fictional state of Midlands. UCMT fields teams of approximately 10 members each. Each team will represent both the prosecution/plaintiff and the defense, fulfilling roles as attorneys and witnesses. Attorneyshelp to advance the case through opening and closing statements, by directly questioning the witnesses on their side, and destroying the credibility of witnessses on the other side by cross-examining them. It's thewitnesses'job, then, to bolster their side of the case by fending off the aggressive and revealing questions of the other attorney. This is where acting becomes important. A grieving mother or knavish journalist presented with convincing, lifelike emotion may win the judges over to give us an indisputable victory. The Mock Trial Team is a member of the Coalition of Academic Teams.

name: MODA
description_preview: MODA is the premier student-run fashion organization in the Midwest-US. Founded in 2003, MODA is dedicated to providing resources for students interested in fashion through our blog, magazine, Designer Boot Camp program and fashion show!
full_description: MAGAZINE! Entirely run and produced by students, MODA is a unique showcase for talent on campus. And we're still growing- in just a few years, our editorial board has jumped from 8 to 14 students, and our staff has tripled in size to become a 200+ team of photographers, stylists, writers, models and more. In 2013, Teen Vogue recognized the MODA Magazine as one of the best college fashion publications in the nation. You can read the latest issue of MODA Magazinehere! And in the past years, we have attained the title of largest student-run* fashion show in the United States. Designer Boot Camp! Exclusively for UChicago students, MODA’s Designer Boot Camp (DBC) program is a 15-week intensive immersion course in fashion design and garment construction. Over the years, our DBC program has trained dozens of UChicago students with no previous sewing experience. Exclusively for UChicago undergraduates, DBC is a 33-week intensive immersion course in fashion design and garment construction. DBC students also meet with local designers and fashion entrepreneurs to get exposure to careers in fashion. Our DBC alumni ultimately their capsule collections at our annual Winter Fashion Show. In 2015, MODA launched its first ever studio mentorship program in collaboration with the School of the Art Institute ofC Chicago (SAIC). This program, geared towards advanced alumni of the DBC program, gives UChicago students access to mentorship from graduate students of SAIC's fashion department. BLOG! The Blog’s primary purpose is to engage University of Chicago students in a fashion dialogue, highlighting a wide spectrum of viewpoints and delivering immediate fashion news. The MODA Blog reaches an audience of more than 1,200 per day. The blog is a forum for students and Chicagoans to discuss fashion and trends, food and fitness or music and culture. Our staff of bloggers and photographers continues to grow each year, and produces a number of well-known series, including: Quad Style, Study Abroad Files, Looks for Less, and Where & Wear. WINTER FASHION SHOW! Featuring garments by student designers, the MODA Winter Fashion Show is an annual celebration of arts and fashion at UChicago. The annual Winter Fashion Show is MODA's signature event, one of the largest student events and a staple of the UChicago calendar. MODA shows consistently draw in crowds of over 1,000 attendees, and has been hosted at a number of stunning locations, including The Drake, The Geraghty, Theater on the Lake, and Zhou B Art Center. The event includes a pre-show cocktail reception, a dance performance, a runway show and a complimentary after-party at a chic downtown location. The event showcases student designs from our Designer Boot Camp Program and other student designers, and all shows have been entirely student-designed show as of 2016. Almost 200 students are directly involved in producing the event. The event doubles as the launch for the spring issue of the MODA magazine, which also features student designers, models, writers, photographers, stylists and editors. Our team of student models celebrates the diversity of our student body. Finally, the show gives students hands-on experience at the intersection of arts and business, and offers the city a lesser-known side of UChicago. EXECUTIVE BOARD! Gathering dedicated undergraduate students from all backgrounds, the MODA Board leads our programs, organizes our events, and facilitates a discussion about the meaning of fashion at UChicago. Since our founding in 2003, MODA has been a platform dedicated to showcasing fashion on campus, promoting Chicago's style scene and providing resources to students interested in fashion. Through our events, quarterly magazine, daily blog, and Designer Boot Camp program, MODA has established itself as one of the most prominent organizations at the University of Chicago. In partnership with industry professionals, corporate sponsors, and the media, MODA strives to connect the University of Chicago community to the greater Chicago and nationwide fashion industries. The MODA board is made up of two Co-Presidents, Blog Editor-in-Chief, Events Team, Magazine Editor-in-Chief, Sponsorship Team, DBC Director & Deputy Director, Backstage Team, Marketing Team, and a Finance Team.

name: Model United Nations of the University of Chicago
description_preview: MUNUC is the University of Chicago's high-school Model United Nations conference.  Now in our 37th year, we are one of the largest and most prominent conferences in the world, hosting over 3,000 students from around the world.
full_description: Since its founding in 1988, MUNUC's purpose has been: To do so, we run a 3,000-person 4-day high school Model UN Conference in downtown Chicago in February of each year. The time commitment is only 1 hour per week, and you’ll get to be a part of an amazing group of UChicago students by joining MUNUC. We host a bunch of fun, free social events throughout the year!

name: Model United Nations Team, U of C
description_preview: Chicago Model United Nations is comprised of UChicago’s collegiate Model UN conference (ChoMUN) and our top-ranked competitive travelling team. We host ChoMUN in the Spring and Team competes at conferences hosted by schools from across North America.
full_description: Welcome to Chicago Model United Nations, home to UChicago’s collegiate Model UN conference (ChoMUN) and our top-ranked travelling competitive team. We can't wait to have you join! ChoMUN and Team have a large membership overlap, but are functionally distinct organizations, as outlined below: TEAM Team is a close-knit community within the larger sphere of Model UN on campus. We train, travel, and compete together, attending conferences in Chicago, Boston, New York, D.C., Montreal, and Los Angeles. Team, aside from being a great way to develop public speaking and research skills, is a fantastic place to establish mentorship connections and forge long-lasting friendships. New members are eligible to attend conferences starting in November, and we would love for you to join us as we kick off the fall season!! We encourage everyone, regardless of past MUN experience, to come try it out! All majors and interests are welcome, and a vast variety of topics and competitive experiences await you. ChoMUN Hosted by UChicago since 1998, ChoMUN is the premier intercollegiate crisis-focused Model UN conference on the circuit. We run simulations of bodies (known as “committees”) in which delegates assume a character or country and have the chance to change history, both through the committee’s collective actions and their own personal powers. ChoMUN staffers help run committees by creating content and conducting the simulation and planning the committee's narrative, or by assisting in the administrative functions of the conference. ChoMUN will be held spring Quarter at the Palmer House hotel in downtown Chicago. Leading up to the conference, we will hold weekly meetings featuring breakouts into committee subunits along with ChoMUN-wide events. Bonding and community are a central part of the ChoMUN experience, and we're excited to see you all in person this year! ChoMUN is consistently the largest RSO on campus – but due to our nature of being broken down into USG groups and committees, there are many small communities within the bigger ChoMUN family. We're so ecstatic to meet you, and hope that you join us this year! To learn more, head over tohttp://chomun.org/staff-chomunor email our Chief of Staff atcos@chomun.org.

additional_info.Regular Meetings (Day/Time/Location):: Wednesdays, 8 pm (ChoMUN), 9 pm (Team), Stuart 105, Sunday 11 AM (Team), Harper 130

name: Moneythink
description_preview: Moneythink UChicago sends talented student-mentors into high school classrooms all across the city of Chicago to promote financial capability for under-resourced teens.
full_description: Moneythink UChicago sends Uchicago mentors into high school classrooms all across the city of Chicago to promote financial capability for under-resourced teens. We work every day to increase social mobility and break down barriers for urban teens through a proven model of mentorship. Our curriculum contains three parts: financial literacy, college readiness, and entrepreneurship.

name: Moot Court Team
description_preview: We argue appellate cases before a panel of judges or through argument briefs in a national competition. Members gain experience with oral & written arguments, extemporaneous speech and legal reasoning. Absolutely no experience necessary!
full_description: UChicago Moot Court is an internationally ranked team that engages in a variety of kinds of law ranging from American constitutional law to international sports law to space law. We compete against undergrads as well as law students in both domestic and international moot competitions. Members can join the Oral Advocacy team, the Brief Writing team, or both. Competition season takes place through the Fall and Winter quarters with Oral Advocacy tryouts in the beginning of Fall. All prospective members are welcome on the Brief Writing team. In the Spring, we host no-cut training for new and returning members in both Brief Writing and Oral Advocacy. It’s a great experience for anyone interested in learning more about the law, building clear and compelling arguments, and making lifelong friends. No experience necessary! Website here:https://voices.uchicago.edu/mootcourt/

additional_info.Regular Meetings (Day/Time/Location):: Oral Ad Team: Tuesdays and Thursdays 7-9pm CT; Brief Writing Team: Mondays 6-8 pm CT and Wednesdays 7-9 pm CT

name: Multi Ethnic Student Society
description_preview: MESS offers an inclusive space for students of diverse cultural backgrounds to connect and thrive. Join us for meetings, workshops, and activities fostering understanding and solidarity as we come together to celebrate what it means to be Mixed.
full_description: Welcome to the Multi-Ethnic Student Society! MESS provides a warm and welcoming space for multi-ethnic, multi-cultural, and mixed-race students to come together, connect, and thrive. Within our vibrant community, we foster a sense of belonging, solidarity, and understanding among individuals who embody diverse cultural backgrounds and experiences. At MESS, we recognize the importance of creating a supportive environment where members can find community, share resources, and engage in meaningful dialogue. Through regular meetings, engaging workshops, and collaborative activities, we strive to facilitate conversations around identity, heritage, and the complexities of navigating multiple cultural backgrounds. One of our primary objectives is to provide a platform for healing from racial trauma and promoting self-acceptance. We understand that being multi-ethnic or mixed-race can come with its own set of challenges, and we are committed to supporting our members on their journey towards healing and empowerment. Our club offers a diverse range of activities, including crafts, cultural celebrations, guest speakers, and more. These events are designed to celebrate the rich tapestry of cultures within our membership while also fostering deeper connections and understanding. Whether you're looking to explore your own identity, connect with others who share similar experiences, or simply learn more about the diverse world around you, the Multi-Ethnic Student Society welcomes you with open arms. Join us as we embark on a journey of discovery, growth, and solidarity together.

additional_info.Regular Meetings (Day/Time/Location):: The Center of Identity and Inclusion- Amandala Lounge, every other Thursday at 7pm

name: Music Forum
description_preview: The Music Forum is meant to cultivate an informal music community for all social and creative ends.
full_description: The Music Forum is a creative vehicle meant to gather and cultivate an informal music community. We gather musicians and music lovers from all genres, skill levels, and backgrounds for all creative and social ends. This includes collaborations, meeting other musicians, hosting student-run concerts for student compositions, giant jam sessions, album listening/music sharing, music discussion, general meetups/sandwiches, composition critiques etc. Ultimately, we want to create a positive and creative space for music lovers to do music, whether you play 4 chords on the guitar or write symphonies.

name: Muslim Students Association
description_preview: The Muslim Students Association at UChicago strives to foster an environment in which Muslim students throughout the University can engage in their academic pursuits while fulfilling their diverse spiritual, social, and intellectual needs.
full_description: voices.uchicago.edu/msa

name: National Council of Negro Women - UChicago Collegiate Section
description_preview: NCNW – UChicago Collegiate Section is part of a national organization dedicated to supporting and empowering Black women.
full_description: The Mission of the National Council of Negro Women (NCNW) is to lead, empower and advocate for women of African descent, their families and communities. NCNW is open to all persons without regard to gender, race, ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, or socioeconomic status.

name: National Society of Black Engineers
description_preview: The mission of the National Society of Black Engineers is "to increase the number of culturally responsible Black Engineers who excel academically, succeed professionally and positively impact the community."
full_description: NSBE began at Purdue University as the Black Society of Engineers in 1971. It was founded by Anthony Harris, Brian Harris, Stanley L. Kirtley, John W. Logan Jr., Edward A. Coleman, and George A. Smith (known as the “Chicago Six”) in 1975. The NSBE Torch symbolizes the organization’s everlasting, burning desire to achieve success in this competitive society and to effect positive change in the quality of life of all people. The same light that flows from the NSBE Torch to students and professionals in the United States is also useful for NSBE members in other countries in the Americas (Canada, South America, and the Caribbean), as well as in Africa, Europe, South America, Asia, and Australia. The lightning bolts represent the striking impact that will be felt upon society and industry as a result of the contributions and achievements made by NSBE. The organization has since grown to over 30,000 members worldwide, with its headquarters in Alexandria, Virginia. NSBE's primary mission is "to increase the number of culturally responsible black engineers who excel academically, succeed professionally, and positively impact the community." NSBE offers its members leadership training, professional development, mentoring opportunities, career placement services and more. It is NSBE's goal to expand its mission and vision to as many countries around the world as possible, thereby creating a global network of Black engineers, scientists and technologists that support each other, and the cultures they impact.

additional_info.Parent Organization Name and Website::
National Society of Black Engineers 
https://www.nsbe.org/

name: NEURO Club
description_preview: The Neuroscience Education, University Research, and Outreach (NEURO) Club shares neuroscience in and outside of the College.

name: New Americans UChicago
description_preview: New Americans UChicago (NAUC) is a service-based student group that partners with local community organizations to assist Chicago residents in the US naturalization process, while also educating UChicago students on issues surrounding immigration.
full_description: New Americans UChicago (NAUC) is a service-based student group that partners with local community organizations and allows students to tutor Chicago residents seeking to take the U.S. Citizenship test by developing their English skills, testing their civics knowledge, and helping them fill out the citizenship application. NAUC also seeks to educate UC students on issues surrounding immigration and naturalization from this immersive experience in immigrant communities. Student tutors travel to Pilsen with their tutor groups to work with students at the Institute for Latino Progress. Tutoring opportunities have re-opened in person throughout the week, with options for 1:1 virtual tutoring available as well. There are also opportunities for volunteering at local workshops, participating in on-campus events, and assisting with fundraisers.

name: neXus Dance Collective
description_preview: NeXus aims to connect people through their love of Korean pop music and dance. We provide a space for people of all backgrounds and levels of dance experience to learn and grow not only as dancers but more generally as artists and people as well.
full_description: neXus is UChicago's premier K-pop dance RSO, founded in 2019. They are the only RSO that runs a fully operant YouTube channel, at 700+ subscribers and growing. neXus’ robust team of dancers, video producers and editors, stylists, marketers, event planners, and show and staging team make their weekly YouTube videos, quarterly showcases, and annual Midwest-wide dance competition, KonneX, possible. Their love of K-Pop fosters a thriving, talented community that engages with not only the Chicago dance community but K-Pop dance crews across the country as well.

name: Occam's Razor
description_preview: Occam's Razor is UChicago's independent improv comedy troupe, bringing the funniest and freest improv to our campus since 1999.
full_description: Occam's Razor is UChicago's independent improv comedy troupe, bringing the funniest and freest improv to our campus since 1999.

name: Oeconomica
description_preview: University of Chicago's undergraduate economics society.
full_description: Oeconomica is the undergraduate economics research society. We help to facilitate undergraduate research through workshops and discussions. We host several events throughout the year, engaging students with faculty members and their research.

name: Open Ultimate
description_preview: A sport club dedicated to teaching and playing Ultimate Frisbee.
full_description: Whether you are a beginner who just wants to learn what Ultimate is all about, or if you are a seasoned veteran looking for a way to keep playing the sport you love, the University of Chicago open team would love to have you play with us. For those of you who want to know what Ultimate is,USA Ultimatedescribes it as the "non-stop movement and athletic endurance of soccer with the aerial passing skills of football." Another key component of Ultimate is the "Spirit of the Game". Ultimate tends to be a fun, spirited sport, and all levels of commitment and skill are welcomed. "Open" is the official term used by USA ultimate for the 'men's' division of play because while men's division teams most often consist of only male-identifying players, players who identify as female are allowed to compete in this division, thus making it "open" to any gender in terms of eligibility. We host two open teams. Fission is our A-team and is the highest level of open ultimate at UChicago, representing the university in the USA Ultimate D-I College Division, and as such represents a serious commitment. Players on Fission are also expected to attend three regular season tournaments and the college series postseason (consisting of sectionals, regionals, and, hopefully, nationals). Hedonism Bots, our B-team, is a rising program in the developmental division. However, it does not carry the same rigor in performance and commitment that Fission does. Attendance to practices, tournaments, and pods is not required for B-team membership, and anybody interested in ultimate at UChicago may participate in B-team practices. The goal of Bots is to provide a fun, inclusive environment for people who enjoy playing ultimate. We generally practice 2-3 times a week (twice during the week and once during the weekends) in addition to informal throwing sessions and workouts, and we go to several tournaments a season. We pride ourselves on sportsmanship, spirit, and fun.So come and see what playing for Fission and Bots is all about! *If you're interested in joining, please email us at chicagoultimate@gmail.com.

name: Organization of Black Students
description_preview: The purpose of OBS shall be to provide an organizational framework to address issues of concern to the Black community and cultivate engaging and welcoming spaces of solidarity. To connect with OBS, please email obsuchicago1968@gmail.com
full_description: The purpose of the Organization of Black Students (OBS) at the University of Chicago shall be to provide an organizational framework to address issues of concern to the Black community and cultivate engaging and welcoming spaces of solidarity. OBS shall ensure the continual growth of Black culture, care, and community primarily on campus, as well, in the greater Chicago community when the opportunity arises. The Organization of Black Students shall serve as a support, protection, and catalyst to Black students and their development. It will endeavor to build a better understanding of the Black experience that, through its members, programs, resources, and functions, will permeate the University atmosphere and develop Community solidarity. In this respect, OBS shall contribute to the pursuit of Black expression, understanding, and awareness.

name: Organization of Latin American Students
description_preview: The Organization of Latin American Students at UChicago is a student organization that promotes political, social, and cultural awareness, within and beyond the Latinx community, supporting of the Latinx community on both a collegiate and community plane
full_description: We as Latinx people at the University of Chicago acknowledge and recognize that cohesiveness and true power comes from diversity. We endeavor to promote awareness, within and beyond the Latinx community, that incorporates all facets of our culture. It is our mission to promote political, social, and cultural awareness that furthers the progression of the Latinx community on both collegiate and community planes. We aim to accomplish this through the union of both Latinxs and other students interested in Latinx culture. Through our collaborative effort we can ensure the appreciation, promotion, and furthering of our diverse heritages. Sign up for ourlisthostto stay up to date on meeting times and locations.

name: Organization of LGBTQ+ Students
description_preview: Organization of LGBTQ+ Students
full_description: The purpose of The Organization of LGBTQ+ Students (OLS) at the University of Chicago is to foster an accepting and inclusive environment for all LGBTQ+ identifying students at the University by addressing issues of concern to the LGBTQ+ community and cultivating spaces of that acceptance and inclusivity. OLS ensures that there is a continual and rapid growth of LGBTQ+ acceptance, care, and community not only within the constraints of the University campus but in the greater Chicago area as opportunities present themselves. OLS endeavors to continuously strengthen our alliances with non-LGBTQ+ identifying students and community members while conjointly meeting the needs of our Community. We continuously aspire to build a better understanding of the LGBTQ+ community through our events, programs, and resources so that we may permeate an educated, uplifting, and welcoming University atmosphere and develop community solidarity. In this respect, OLS contributes to the prosperity of LGBTQ+ expression, acceptance, and understanding.

name: Orthodox Christian Fellowship
description_preview: We are a pan-Orthodox group of students who meet for worship, spiritual development and support. Our mission is to unite members through community life, service and study while bearing witness to the unique message of the Orthodox Christian Faith.
full_description: We are a pan-Orthodox group of students who meet for worship, spiritual development and support. Our mission is to unite members through community life, service and study while bearing witness to the unique message of the Orthodox Christian Faith. Members of UChicago OCF attend various Orthodox churches throughout Chicago, but you'll find most of us at St. Makarios Orthodox Mission in Hyde Park. Our spiritual advisor is St. Makarios' priest-in-charge, Fr. Philip Maikkula. Join us at St. Makarios for Vespers on Saturdays at 5 p.m. and Liturgy on Sundays at 10 a.m. To get connected with OCF, email Fr. Philip (pmaikkula@gmail.com) or our organizational email (uchicago.orthodox@gmail.com).

name: Outdoor Adventure Club
description_preview:
The OAC brings together students with a spirit of adventure interested in outdoor exploration! We have activities from weekly bonfires to camping/ backpacking trips around the country!
Join our listhost to receive info about event signups!
full_description: The Outdoor Adventure Club is an RSO dedicated to connecting members of the UChicago community who share an appreciation of nature and a passion for the outdoors! We have weekly bonfires at the point, camping trips, and other awesome opportunities to get outside!Join our listhost to receive info about event signups! We aim to hike, camp, kayak, climb, and spelunk our way through the academic year while building friendships in a non-library setting. Previous destinations include: Students of all levels of experience are encouraged to learn new skills and utilize already acquired skills to educate their peers while enjoying the great outdoors. Our listhost is a great way for those interested in the outdoors and awesome adventures to connect with like minded souls. The club typically plans four or five trips a quarter along with half a dozen grand Spring Break adventures, and hosts outdoor-themed movie nights, slacklining/BBQs on the Quad, and bonfires at Promontory Point. We also own and rent outdoor equipment to the greater UChicago community. Anyone can propose a trip or adventure idea; given sufficient interest, the club is often able to facilitate funding and planning. Join our listhost and stop by a meeting to see what we're all about!

name: OutLaw
description_preview: OutLaw is the society for LGBT and allied students at the University of Chicago Law School. OutLaw seeks to provide a welcoming atmosphere for LGBT students, foster discussion about LGBT legal issues, and promote the legal equality of LGBT individuals.
full_description: OutLaw is the society for gay, lesbian, bisexual, transgendered, and allied students at the University of Chicago Law School. OutLaw seeks to provide a welcoming atmosphere for LGBT students, foster discussion about the various legal issues affecting the LGBT community, and promote the legal equality of LGBT individuals. Through bringing in speakers to discuss the changing rights and concerns facing the LGBT community, OutLaw works to expand the Law Schools understanding of contemporary LGBT topics. In addition to speaking events, OutLaw also provides mentoring services to its members, participates in university diversity initiatives, and volunteers within the local community.

name: OUTPatient
description_preview: OUTPatient offers education and programming to the Pritzker and broader University community on LGBTQ related topics, advocates for LGBTQ-related issues and causes in healthcare, and provides a social forum for LGBTQ+ students.
full_description: The Medical Student Pride Alliance (MSPA) is an activist and social organization committed to empowering sexual and gender minority medical students and allies, increasing the number of physicians trained in LGBTQ-inclusive healthcare and addressing the unique needs of LGBTQ+ communities through research, advocacy, and service. Known as OUTPatient from its inception through December 2020, this chapter of MSPA offers education and programming to the Pritzker and broader University community on LGBTQ related topics, advocates for LGBTQ-related issues and causes in healthcare, and provides a social forum for LGBTQ Pritzker and undergraduate pre-med students.

name: Outside the Lines
description_preview: Outside the Lines is a student-run fine arts organization at the University of Chicago. The group imbricates both on-campus figure drawing sessions and off-campus artist critiques, exhibitions, and socials that build a social platform for student artists
full_description: Outside the Lines is a student-run fine arts organization at the University of Chicago. The group imbricates both on-campus figure drawing sessions and off-campus artist critiques, exhibitions, and socials that aim to build a social platform in which student artists at both the BA and MFA level are encouraged to share their practice and receive feedback on current projects. Previous side projects include TOUGH LOVE, an artist collective/idea exchange that involves group critiques on individual creative projects. We also hosted PASS THE SALT, an informal dinner party that took place in SHoP headquarters which brought together students, community members, and good food in the form of a potluck. For more information please visit our website at: http://otluchicago.wordpress.com/ And for any questions, comments, or collaboration proposals feel free to contact us at: otl.uchicago@gmail.com We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Paleontology Club
description_preview: We aim to bring together students interested in paleontology, give them hands-on experience and useful skills, and provide them guidance for a promising future in paleontology.
full_description: The organization offers opportunities for students to learn about paleontology concepts, as well as academic, research and career opportunities, though guest speakers, workshops, museum trips and other exclusive content.  The RSO expects members to have no background experience in the field, only a passion for learning about prehistoric life.

name: PanAsian Solidarity Coalition
description_preview: PanAsia Solidarity Coalition is a student-run RSO at the University of Chicago dedicated to intersectional political advocacy centered on Asian/Asian-American identity.
full_description: PanAsia Solidarity Coalition is a student-run RSO at the University of Chicago dedicated to intersectional political advocacy centered on Asian/Asian-American identity.By Asian, we meanallAsians, whether you are South, West, East, or Southeast Asian, 1st or 4th generation diaspora, multiracial or monoracial, transnational adoptee, indigenous, queer etc. Without presuming that “Asian/Asian-American” are self-evident, stable, or homogenous categories, PanAsia Solidarity Coalition strives to both work across national and cultural boundaries in solidarity for positive social change, and recognize difference as a basis for political action. Asians and Asian-Americans, however defined, are situated at the crossroads of various axes of marginalization, including class, gender, sexuality, ethnicity, nationality, ability, and religion. Recognizing that the fight against white supremacist capitalist patriarchy in the United States is inextricably linked to ongoing struggles against settler colonialism, anti-Blackness, and American dominance throughout the Global South, and that Asians and Asian-Americans are often complicit in these same violences, PanAsia Solidarity Coalition aims to provide a political platform to push for positive change and visibility. PanAsia Solidarity Coalition therefore seeks to build a politics of difference allied with other minority groups to promote “Third World” solidarity at the University of Chicago, and aims to work with other Asian identity groups on campus to provide complementary political and social spaces for students, such as discussions, events, current events-related programming, and published statements.

name: Paragon Global Investments
description_preview: Paragon Global Investments, formally known as Paragon National Group, is an intercollegiate finance organization, intersecting in the fields of quantitative finance and value investing. We educate students in these topics, as well as host firms on campus
full_description: Paragon Global Investments is a student-led intercollegiate investment fund with chapters at Brown University, Columbia University, Cornell University, New York University, Princeton University, the University of Chicago, and the University of Pennsylvania. The organization is dedicated to the development of students in value investing and algorithmic trading.Students admitted to PGI follow an educational curriculum that teaches applied value investing and algorithmic trading. Upon completing the education portion, students will join the organization either as investment analysts or quantitative analysts, working on stock pitches or designing systematic algorithms that will be invested into or deployed into PGI's $40,000 investment funds. Since our inception, we have grown to 300+ active students and every year we receive close to 2,000 students interested in joining our organization nationally

name: Pareto Solutions
description_preview: Pareto Solutions is a student-run consulting group at UChicago. We seek to provide actionable, customized solutions focused on operational and brand management strategies for our clients.
full_description: Pareto Solutions is a student-run consulting group at the University of Chicago. Founded in January 2013, our mission is to serve as a bridge between UChicago and the local community through conducting short-term marketing engagements. We strive to develop a research driven, data-backed plan of action to facilitate clients’ operational and branding initiatives. Our practical recommendations are uniquely customized for the diverse needs of each client, and capitalize on our holistic understanding of the local community. Our engagements are generally 8 to 10 weeks long, but we are flexible on the length depending on our client’s requirements. Members will have the opportunity to develop skills in data analysis, learn and use business frameworks, conduct primary research, and work on marketing engagements that create positive impact on the community. In addition to practical consulting experience, our training curriculum will provide members with the relevant skills needed to succeed as a consultant.

name: Paul Douglas Institute
description_preview: The Paul Douglas Institute is a student-run, public policy think tank based at the University of Chicago. We channel public policy interest on campus into solution-orientated research projects that allow students to make an impact on the policy process.

name: Pediatric Health and Wellness Initiative
description_preview: The purpose of this organization shall be to provide free medical care to uninsured or underinsured pediatric patients from underserved Southside communities. Our current services are vaccinations, sports physicals, lead testing, and diabetes screenings.

name: Pep Band
description_preview: The Pep Band's purpose is to make awesome music by means of an instrument external to the human body and spread school spirit at athletic events and other important community and university occasions.
full_description: The University of Chicago Pep Band, or simply"The Band", is currently comprised of 15-17 student members who play at school and community events throughout the year. In the Fall, we regularly play at as many home football games as we can manage (including Homecoming!), and in the Winter we play at a lot of home basketball games. In the spring, we perform at many community events such asC2E2.We are always looking for more events to play at (particularly in the spring), and more amazing musicians to join us!

full_description: As a preprofessional organization, our mission is to provide students interested in law with information regarding the law school application process, law school, and various careers in law. We conduct weekly meetings where we invite law professionals such as law school admissions officers, law school professors, and attorneys to share their experiences and answer questions from members. Perhaps most importantly, we function as a community of undergraduates with similar interests and a desire to support one another in pursuit of those interests.

full_description: The UCPR is a biannual, thematic journal which seeks to publish philosophically-driven, undergraduate essays. The journal looks for papers from undergraduate institutions throughout the world. Alongside these essays, the journal also publishes interviews and lectures from more well-known professors or thinkers. By combining these two types of pieces, the journal strives to showcase our university as well as provide a platform for undergraduate authors to showcase their studies.

full_description: Phoenix Development Fund is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that provides pro-bono business development services to small businesses and non-profits in socioeconomically disadvantaged neighborhoods. name: Phoenix Farms
description_preview: Phoenix Farms is UChicago's premier beekeeping, mycology, and urban farming RSO.
full_description: Phoenix Farms is UChicago's premier beekeeping, mycology, and urban farming RSO. We keep bees and grow food for ourselves and others across the South Side. We also regularly volunteer at local community gardens in need of cleanup. Our primary goal as an RSO is to educate the student body and surrounding population on urban gardening, mycology, and beekeeping practices.

name: Phoenix Funds
description_preview: Undergraduate finance and markets educational group.
full_description: Phoenix Fundsis a collaborative finance learning group at the University of Chicago. We are dedicated to making seemingly abstract financial theory accessible to undergraduate students through a variety of fun and engaging learning techniques, while exposing them to a tight-knit community where they can form real connections with both each other and the members of leadership. Our interactive and hands-on approach helps to make finance theory understandable and applicable to real-world situations.We look for members with a genuine interest in finance and giving back to the club, all from a variety of backgrounds and interests. The diverse curriculum allows students to explore their interests in a variety of fields before deciding where to focus, allowing anyone from any major to succeed. We maintain a small, selective group on purpose, as it allows us to foster an engaged community.

name: Phoenix Gaming and Esports
description_preview: Welcome to Phoenix Gaming and Esports, home of the University of Chicago's number one D1 Sports team. We're open to any and all who enjoy gaming, whether you're looking to play competitively or casually.
full_description: Thank you for you interest and wanting to know more about us! Our goals are as follows: 1. To develop a community at the University of Chicago for competitive and casual esports fans to congregate and play games for fun, as well as enjoy the competitive tournaments going on across the world.2. To create an atmosphere where competitive players can train and do well playing within various intercollegiate circuits, such as the Collegiate Starleague (CSL), Tespa, GG.Leagues, etc.3. We currently have interest in games such as Overwatch, StarCraft II, League of Legends, Hearthstone, Dota 2. Rainbow 6: Siege, Counter-Strike: Global Offensive, and many more.

name: Phoenix Survivors Alliance
description_preview: Phoenix Survivors Alliance is a group of student survivors & allies who advocate for and encourage and engagement with issues of sexual assault, harassment, and gender discrimination to promote initiatives and leadership in this field.
full_description: We are a peer-led organization of student survivors & allies who work, research, and collaborate to provide information, advocacy, and peer support to survivors of sexual violence at UChicago. Our mission is to: In our effort to provide survivor-centered support, we believe that:

name: Phoenix Sustainability Initiative
description_preview: Phoenix Sustainability Initiative seeks to actively identify and promote environmentally sustainable policies and practices with the University and wider Chicago community.
full_description: 2019-2020 RSO of the Year! Founded in April 2013, Phoenix Sustainability Initiative (PSI) is a Recognized Student Organization at the University of Chicago that seeks to advance environmentally sustainable policies and practices on campus and with the wider Chicago community. Currently, PSI offers 8 working projects that address issues of specific interest to our members: Campus Composting; Green Partnerships; Environmental Education; Green Data; Campus Waste Reduction; Community Action; Divest UChicago; and Science, Art and Sustainability (SAS). Follow our Facebook page for application links and other organization-specific information: https://www.facebook.com/PhoenixSustainabilityUChicago Also, check out our Instagram for sustainability tips here: https://www.instagram.com/sustainableuchicago/?fbclid=IwAR175GNBvmYKpjh-WFeucDmerIdCDBKctD2MBaCixWRKSkxXUId-FybA83Q

name: Phoenix Tutoring
description_preview: Phoenix Tutoring hosts several in-person and virtual sessions weekly. We provide individualized education for local K-12 students, and are committed to making quality tutoring services accessible for our community.
full_description: At Phoenix Tutoring, we strive to allow K-12 students in the greater Chicago area to achieve their full academic potential. We recognize that education extends beyond the classroom. Thus, we are committed to providing free, quality tutoring services that enhance the traditional learning found in the classroom. Our team of UChicago student tutors collaborate with K-12 students to deliver personalized support, guidance, and mentorship.As we recognize the uniqueness of each student, tutoring sessions are tailored to address their specific needs— be it clarifying challenging concepts, reviewing coursework, honing effective study techniques, or fostering confidence in their academic abilities. To ensure that we are able to accommodate our students and tutors schedules, we offer both virtual and in-person tutoring options.We are not only dedicated to bridging educational gaps but also cultivate a nurturing environment for our students. We manage all communication with parents, allowing our tutors and students to focus exclusively on their weekly tutoring sessions. Our ultimate objective is to ensure that dependable and accessible tutoring is available to the greater Chicago community, allowing every student to have the opportunity to excel academically.

name: Platypus
description_preview: Platypus is a project for the self-criticism, self-education, and ultimately, the practical reconstitution of a Marxian Left. We organize reading groups, public fora, research & journalism focused on problems and tasks inherited from the historical Left.
full_description: Statement of Purpose: Platypus is a project for the self-criticism, self-education, and, ultimately, the practical reconstitution of a Marxian Left. At present the Marxist Left appears as a historical ruin. The received wisdom of today dictates that past, failed attempts at emancipation stand not as moments full of potential yet to be redeemed, but rather as “what was” — utopianism that was bound to end in tragedy. As critical inheritors of a vanquished tradition, Platypus contends that — after the failure of the 1960s New Left, and the dismantlement of the welfare state and the destruction of the Soviet Union in the 1980s-90s — the present disorientation of the Left means we can hardly claim to know the tasks and goals of social emancipation better than the “utopians” of the past did. Our task is critique and education towards the reconstitution of a Marxian Left. Platypus contends that the ruin of the Marxist Left as it stands today is of a tradition whose defeat was largely self-inflicted, hence at present the Marxist Left is historical, and in such a grave state of decomposition that it has become exceedingly difficult to draft coherently programmatic social-political demands. In the face of the catastrophic past and present, the first task for the reconstitution of a Marxian Left as an emancipatory force is to recognize the reasons for the historical failure of Marxism and to clarify the necessity of a Marxian Left for the present and future. —If the Left is to change the world, it must first transform itself! The improbable — but not impossible — reconstitution of an emancipatory Left is an urgent task; we believe that the future of humanity depends on it. While the devastating forces unleashed by modern society — capitalism — remain, the unfulfilled promise of social emancipation still calls for redemption. To abdicate this or to obscure the gravity of past defeats and failures by looking to “resistance” from “outside” the dynamics of modern society is to affirm its present and guarantee its future destructive reality. Platypus asks the questions: How is the thought of critical theorists of modern society such as Marx, Lukács, Benjamin and Adorno relevant for the struggle for social emancipation today? How can we make sense of the long history of impoverished politics on the Left leading to the present — after the international Marxist Left of Lenin, Luxemburg and Trotsky, to the barrenness of today — without being terrorized or discouraged by this history? — How might the answers to such questions help the urgent task of reconstituting the Left at its most fundamental levels of theory and practice? How might we help effect escape from the dead-end the Left has become? We hope to re-invigorate a conversation on the Left that has long since fallen into senility or silence, in order to help found anew an emancipatory political practice that is presently absent. What has the Left been, and what can it yet become?— Platypus exists because the answer to such a question, even its basic formulation, has long ceased to be self-evident.
