description_preview: Increasing Southeast Asian Perspectives on Campus
full_description: SeaSOC is invested in increasing the perspective of Southeast Asians on the UChicago campus. We create content on our website, publication, as well as organize events for both Southeast Asians and non-Southeast Asians alike! Come say hi!

name: University of Chicago Undergraduate Law Magazine
description_preview: The UChicago Undergraduate Law Magazine is the College's only undergraduate publication focused on academic legal writing. In addition to publishing annual print editions and social media content, we will host educational workshops and film screenings.
full_description: University of Chicago Undergraduate Law Magazine: Re-established in 2022, the University of Chicago Undergraduate Law Magazine, or the ULM, is the College's premier legal publication. The ULM offers itself a collaborative and educational pre-professional community.

name: University Theater
description_preview: University Theater is the premier student theater RSO at UChicago, producing over 35 annual shows that range from staged readings to mainstage productions. We provide opportunities to act in, direct, manage, and design shows - no experience required!
full_description: University Theater produces 35+ shows a year, ranging from staged-readings to full mainstage productions, reaching over 10,000 patrons. As one of the oldest student-run theaters in the country, UT provides students with the unique experience of having artistic control over every aspect of their work. We believe the best way to find your voice is to try it out. To this end, productions are designed, acted in, and directed by students. From canonical texts to student-written musicals, productions represent an opportunity for students to try out ideas from classes, collaborate with other artists and professionals within theTAPS academic department, and contribute to the cultural life of the University. UT produces a mainstage season every quarter and workshops during fall and winter. We encompassthe Dean's Men, a group dedicated to Shakespeare's work,Off-Off Campus, an improvisational comedy group, andTheater[24], a festival of new plays that are written, directed, rehearsed, and designed by students within 24 hours! For the latest information, join our listhost atthis link, follow us onFacebookandInstagram, and see our website atut.uchicago.edu.

name: Urban Policy Student Association
description_preview: UPSA is a community of students interested in the policy decisions, political dynamics, and social issues that shape cities around the world.
full_description: UPSA is a community of UChicago students interested in the policy decisions, political dynamics, and social issues that shape cities around the world. We host creative thinkers in urban policy and innovation, visit leading organizations in Chicago, and offer professional development and networking for students energized by urban policy.

name: URoad Runners
description_preview: Road Runners brings together the running community through group runs and encourages members to set goals to compete in road races in Chicago. The club also provides advice on how to train, as well as race sponsorships for its members.
full_description: The purpose of University of Chicago Road Runners is to encourage and foster the running community on campus and to aid runners in race training to meet their personal goals in road running races in the city of Chicago. The RSO also serves as a base for forming student training groups and allows experienced runners to offer newcomers advice for how to train, choose running equipment, become a certified pacer, and contact charities about sponsorships. The club also offers opportunities for members to compete in road races. Join our WhatsApp by clicking our Instagram bio!

additional_info.Regular Meetings (Day/Time/Location):: Group Run Times change per quarter: Monday-Thursday 5:30PM

name: UROCK Climbing Club
description_preview: URock promotes rock climbing in the UChicago community by providing opportunities for first-time climbers to try out the activity, obtaining special deals for experienced climbers to get gym memberships, and leading outdoor trips to crags near and far.
full_description: Our goal is to support climbers and climbing on campus. We welcome beginners interested in trying rock climbing, and pros crushing 5.13s! We climb primarily at First Ascent and get together some outdoor trips to Devil's Lake, Holy Boulders, etc. We also host weekly on-campus strength training - all levels welcome. Boulderers, top-ropers, sport climbers, trad climbers, and those just discovering climbing are all welcome! Also, check out our Instagram and Facebook pages with the links below.

name: Veteran Scholar Association
description_preview: VSA is the UChicago chapter of Student Veterans of America. We have a commitment to recognize, support, and mentor military-affiliated students through networking opportunities, resource awareness, and campus and community engagement.
full_description: Welcome to theVeteran Scholar Association (VSA)at the University of Chicago! This registered student organization (RSO) serves as a communication hub for all members affiliated with the UChicago Veteran Scholar Association, including current students, alumni, faculty, and staff who are veterans or supporters of veteran education and integration within the university community.The primarypurposeof this RSO is to provide updates, share resources, and facilitate discussions related to veterans' experiences in higher education. Our focus is on fostering a supportive environment for veteran scholars by providing academic resources, professional development opportunities, and networking events.

name: Voices in Your Head
description_preview: Voices in Your Head (also known as Voices) is an all gender acappella group comprised of both graduate and undergraduate students. They perform music from a wide variety of genres, and are known for their unique interpretations and arrangements.
full_description: Co-EdVoices in Your Head, (also known as Voices) is a student-run, all gender a cappella group from the University of Chicago. Founded in 1998, the group has consisted of both undergraduate and graduate students whose studies range from Economics to Music to MD/PhD programs. Voices arranges all of its own music, spanning several genres. Its unique repertoire includes original pieces, as well as an eclectic mix of pop, R&B, rock, and alternative music. Voices has competed in theInternational Championship of Collegiate A Cappella (ICCA)since 2009, and was honored to win third place at the 2018 ICCA Finals performing a set of entirely original lyrics, music and choreography. They previously competed in the 2017, 2015, and 2012 ICCA Finals, where they placed second, second, and fourth. In December 2013, Voices toured the midwest and sang with various high schools in Michigan, Illinois, and Wisconsin. Voices has traveled to such festivals asSoJamandBoston Sings, receiving first place at the latter's Collegiate Competition and getting the chance to open for pro groupsCadenceand Traces. Since 2011, Voices has garnered 5 Contemporary A Cappella Recording Awards, as well as RARB's 2014 Single of the Year for "Burn." In the past, Voices has been selected to appear on all three major a cappella competitions:Voices Only,Sing, andBest of Collegiate A Cappella. Follow us onTwitter, find us onYouTube, like us onFacebook, visit ourwebsite, or send us anemailfor more information!

name: Volleyball
description_preview: In the absence of a Men's Varsity team, Volleyball provides men and women a place to play volleyball at a fairly competitive level. That being said, everyone is welcome, and we will try to improve everyone's ability with drills, games, and tournaments.
full_description: Club Volleyball is created with the express purpose to provide a competitive outlet for volleyball players in the absence of a Men's Varsity team. We hold practices about 8 hours a week, and try to get to a couple tournaments a quarter, culminating in taking a men's team to Nationals in early spring quarter. That being said, we welcome women players as well. Everyone is welcome, although people should be aware that we try and play at a fairly competitive level. If you are unsure if this is the right place for you, come out and play anyway, and we can always train you up to get better if that is your goal as well.

name: Vélo Club
description_preview: UCVC is a major club structure for the cycling community in Hyde Park. We will host weekly group rides focusing on cycling techniques. We welcome anyone who is interested in either recreational riding or racing.

name: Water Polo
description_preview: A coed water polo club team that competes year-round.
full_description: The UChicago Water Polo team welcomes all university affiliates, from no waterpolo experience to ex-players. We're a co-ed team of around 20-30 players that competes in various local tournaments year-round! Our team is as much a social group of friends as we are a water polo team and we'd love to have you join! Autumn quarter practices are at the Ratner Athletics Center Pool 7-9PM Tues/Thurs and 10am-12pm Saturdays. Just show up to any practice to join! We use the email listhost for most up to date and rapid communications. Please contactghoshm@uchicago.eduif you would like to be added the listhost or have any questions/inquiries. Follow us on Instagram! @ucwaterpolo 2023-2024 Officers: President: Miki GhoshCaptains: Baylee Ha (W) & Henry Rose (M) Contact Info:

additional_info.Regular Meetings (Day/Time/Location):: Tuesday and Thursday 7-9PM, Saturday 10:00AM-12PM @ Ratner Pool

name: WHPK
description_preview: "The Pride of the South Side." Broadcasting 100% independent programming live daily to the South Side of Chicago and streaming worldwide at www.whpk.org
full_description: WHPK is a non-profit community radio station of the University of Chicago, broadcasting to Hyde Park and the South Side of Chicago for over 60 years.WHPK is dedicated to playing music not commonly heard on mainstream radio. Our programming consists of a wide variety of music for an equally diverse listening audience. Such broad appeal is evident from the many formats we offer. These include Rock, Jazz, Classical, International, Hip-Hop, Electronic, and Folk, as well as specialty shows featuring avant-garde, Blues, dance music, and live in-studio performances.WHPK is not only dedicated to music. It has an equally renowned Public Affairs Format where community concerns are voiced and where interviews with local politicians and other public figures can be heard.Do you have a question for WHPK? Email us at sm@whpk.org and we will be happy to answer it! Please see our instagram if you'd like to find more information about events. If you'd like to be updated on volunteer opportunities, subscribe to our email list host or come to office hours. It's easy to get involved, and there's something everyone can contribute, regardless of time commitment. www.whpk.org

additional_info.Regular Meetings (Day/Time/Location):: Board meetings: Tuesdays, 6:00pm biweekly. Office hours (for volunteers): mondays,  3pm-5pm. Both take place in the station office, at the top of the stairs near the entrance to Hutchinson Commons in Reynolds Club.

name: Windmill Chinese Drama Club
description_preview: Windmill Chinese Drama Club aims at promoting Chinese culture by performing Chinese stage plays, both classical and original, both on campus as well as outside UChicago.
full_description: Windmill Chinese Drama Club aims at promoting Chinese culture by performing Chinese stage plays, both classical and original, both on campus as well as outside UChicago.

name: Women and Youth Supporting Each Other
description_preview: WYSE is a national mentoring organization that empowers young women with the information and resources they need to make healthy, informed decisions and become leaders in their communities. Our branch works at Drake and Ray Elementary Schools.
full_description: What Is WYSE?WYSE is a national mentoring organization dedicated to strengthening the lives of young women and their communities. It is a curriculum based mentorship program striving to address issues that will facilitate the self-empowerment of young women, including topics such as racism, sexism, healthy body image, comprehensive sex education, sexual orientation, drugs, gangs, teenage pregnancy, and future options. WYSE began at UCLA in 1992 and has spread to 13 branches at 12 universities nationwide. The National Resource Office (NRO) recently dissolved and is now in the form of a Board of Directors. They hope to restore the NRO in the near future. Mission & Goals:(1) To provide middle school girls with the resources and support necessary to make informed decisions about relationships, sexual health, and their futures. (2) To provide college women with the skills and insight necessary to become life-long advocates for expanding opportunities for all women. (3) To provide a national network of support and friendship between young women working towards positive changes in their communities. Why WYSE?WYSE works with middle school girls from under-resourced areas. At this age, girls are beginning to make decisions about themselves, their relation to males, their racial, gender, and class identities, and their position in society. This is further complicated when the girls are part of a racial/ethnic minority and in an under-resourced community. Where Does WYSE Work?The University of Chicago branch of WYSE works at John B. Drake Elementary School on the South Side of Chicago. Drake is part of the Dearborn Homes community. Prior to working at Drake, the U of C WYSE chapter worked in at Madero Middle School in Little Village for twenty years. WYSE Mentees:The girls we mentor are from the 6th, 7th, and 8thgrades at John B. Drake Elementary School. They are at a difficult stage of development and are still rather impressionable, which is why our program targets this age group. However, we avoid making generalizations about the girls in terms of their knowledge regarding sex, drugs, and gangs. Girls join WYSE out of their own interest and often express a full spectrum of enthusiasm about the program, the mentors, and the lessons. WYSE Mentors:Our group of mentors is very diverse, which is beneficial for the mentees as they are exposed to a variety of women from different cultural groups. We are looking for women of all backgrounds and interests who believe strongly in the WYSE mission and who feel comfortable discussing serious topics with young girls. All mentors must commit to attending all sessions, meetings, and events, and to follow through on individual time with their mentees.

additional_info.Parent Organization Name and Website::
Women and Youth Supporting Each Other
http://www.wyse.org/

name: Women in Business
description_preview: University of Chicago Women in Business (UCWiB) is dedicated to advancing the success of enterprising young women entering the corporate world. WiB unites and teaches undergraduate female leaders, equipping them with the knowledge and skills to succeed.
full_description: The University of Chicago Women in Business (UCWiB) is dedicated to advancing the success of enterprising young women entering the corporate world by providing a platform on which their specific concerns and challenges can be proactively addressed. Through educational, leadership, and mentorship initiatives, WiB seeks to expose women to a variety of business careers and provide extensive networking opportunities. UCWiB serves as a solid liaison between the student body and the corporate world, offering a unique opportunity for women at the University of Chicago to expand and sharpen their knowledge of business opportunities, ultimately giving them the skills to succeed as future leaders.

description_preview: Women in Economics strives to create a community for aspiring female economists that will provide support in research endeavors, resources through external connections, and mentorship opportunities.

name: Women in Science
description_preview: Women in Science's mission is to bring together women at all levels of science, enhancing their educational and professional experiences and providing a forum for discussion of the issues they face.
full_description: Women in Science's mission is to bring together women at all levels of science, enhancing their educational and professional experiences and providing a forum for discussion of the issues they face. We hold various networking events to foster a collaborative and supportive community of women pursuing science across campus.

name: Women Who Lift
description_preview: A strong and supportive community with a passion for weightlifting and women's empowerment.
full_description: Women Who Lift (WWL) is a registered student organization at the University of Chicago empowering people of all backgrounds and identities through weightlifting. We aim to create a supportive community to share our knowledge of proper lifting technique and exercise physiology through group lifts, workshops, and social events.

additional_info.Regular Meetings (Day/Time/Location):: Hour-long Group Lifts - Wednesdays @ 6:15 PM, Saturdays @ 10 AM, in Ratner or Crown (location specified in social media updates and e-mails)

name: Women's Squash
description_preview: Women's Squash Sports Club
full_description: The University of Chicago Squash Club is the University’s organization dedicated to the sport of Squash.  Founded in 2013, the club has grown to be one of the premier club squash teams in the country, offering programming for both competitive players hoping to play against other college squash programs and to recreational players learning how to play the game.

additional_info.Regular Meetings (Day/Time/Location):: Monday, Wednesday, Thursday: 7:00 PM and Saturdays at 10:30AM

name: Women+ in Chemistry
description_preview: Graduate student/post-doc-focused organization that aims to foster relationships between women and gender-minorities ("women+") in the University of Chicago’s Department of Chemistry through social and professional development events.
full_description: We are a primarily graduate student/post-doc-focused organization that aims to foster relationships between women and gender-minorities ("women+") in the University of Chicago’s Department of Chemistry. We aim to create a supportive environment for women+ in chemistry and promote diversity and inclusivity in STEM by hosting monthly social and/or professional development events, meeting with visiting speakers, and performing outreach activities to the local Hyde Park community.

additional_info.Regular Meetings (Day/Time/Location):: Varies. Please check the Google Calendar.

name: Women+ in Law
description_preview: University of Chicago Women+ in Law is dedicated to providing a space for women and nonbinary students at UChicago to explore careers in law, navigate graduate school admissions, and form a community among other students interested in law.
full_description: The University of Chicago Women+ in Law (W+IL) organization is dedicated to advancing the success of young women and nonbinary students by providing a platform in which the specific concerns and challenges of women in the professional world can be addressed proactively. WIL offers a unique opportunity for students at the University of Chicago to expand and sharpen their knowledge of legal opportunities, giving them the skills they will need to become future leaders in the corporate, government, and nonprofit worlds. Through panels, educational sessions, outreach initiatives, skill-building workshops, leadership projects, mentorship programs, and social events, WIL seeks to expose members to a variety of legal careers and provide extensive networking opportunities. WIL serves as the crucial link in creating a solid liaison between the student body and law professionals. Throughout the year, general members in WIL will participate in modules and seminars dedicated to LSAT preparation, exploring career opportunities, and workshops on resume and cover letter writing. WIL will host a variety of panels from speakers that are at the top of their fields, and members will also have the opportunity to visit firms and learn about other legal careers in the Chicago area. The establishment of WIL, the sole organization of its kind on campus, is significant in its ability to provide a pre-professional networking opportunity for women and nonbinary students.

name: Writers' Workshop
description_preview: Organized creative writing workshops.
full_description: The Writers' Workshop seeks to develop the creative writing ability of its members through a process of workshops and drills. Focus will be put on collaboration with peers to examine critically students' fiction and poetry.

name: Yoga Club
description_preview: We are a student organisation which runs drop-in yoga classes two to three times a week.
full_description: We are a student organization which runs drop-in vinyasa yoga classes two to three times a week during the academic year,  and once a week during the summer quarter. We provide high-quality instruction in Iyengar yoga to the University of Chicago community and to the Hyde Park and neighboring communities. The practice of yoga strengthens both the body and the mind and addresses issues as diverse as pain from poor alignment and emotional stress. Iyengar Yoga is a didactic practice which focuses on body alignment and makes frequent use of props such as belts, chairs, and blocks to make poses accessible to people at all levels. All classes are multi-level, so beginners are welcome at any time. Sticky mats and all other props are provided. We recommend practitioners to come to class in shorts (or some other legwear that reveals the curvature of the knee) and on an empty stomach. With Club sponsorship, classes usually cost $5 for students and $10 for non-students, and we sometimes sponsor free classes for everyone. Classes are held in Ida Noyes.
